SUBSTITUTE TEACHER PAY INCREASE:

As we near the start of the new school year, most districts are dealing with a shortage of substitute teachers. One of my main concerns with keeping our doors open this year could be impacted by having enough subs available for us. In response to this concern, I am very happy to announce that the Mid-Buchanan School District has increased the substitute teacher pay.

1. Substitute teachers that have the 60 college hours to receive certification - $105 per day (this is up from $90 per day).

2. Substitute teachers that are certificated teachers or retired teachers that still have a valid certificate = $125 per day (this is up from $90 per day).

Please join us in welcoming Paige Burns to the Mid Buchanan Elementary as the new Title Reading Specialist.

Paige Burns graduated from Missouri Western with a Bachelors degree in Elementary Education with a concentration in special reading. In May, she will begin her Masters program in Reading at Northwest. Currently, Paige teaches third grade at Winston Elementary. She comes from a long line of educators! Teaching skipped her parents generation, but her grandfather was a fifth generation teacher and an annual basketball tournament is held in Lathrop in his honor. Paige does not share her grandpas love for basketball, but she does share his passion for meeting students where they are. Paige is the typical goofy middle child with an older sister and a younger brother. Paige is excited to share her passion for reading and become a Dragon!

EXTRA FOOD SUPPORT:

The information below was sent to me by our school nurse regarding another option for food support.

For the next 6 weeks on Monday's, 5-7 p.m., Wednesday's 5-7 p.m., and Friday's 5-7 p.m., there will be refrigerated trucks of FREE fresh fruits, vegetables, butter, cottage cheese, milk, and yogurt, all pre-packaged in groups at the east side of East Hills Shopping Center (Sears side) that can be picked up by anyone who needs it. The program is 'Farmers to Families' with food being purchased by the government from farmers who would have to dump the product otherwise. The program is not limited to residents of St. Joseph only -- it is for any of the communities in the surrounding areas as well. Items may also be picked up for neighbors. Product can be picked up by truck and taken back to churches and surrounding communities for dissemination. Four Square Disaster Relief is the sponsoring entity.

If you know of anyone who can benefit, please spread the word!

Thanks, Jay

Mrs. Boyers clothing class has the option of making face masks as a community service project during these trying times. If anyone is interested in making masks or donating supplies, there will be a tote under the awning outside of the small gym to collect these items.

If you would like to donate supplies, we need 100% cotton fabric and  elastic. We would also accept 100% cotton sheets in good condition; fitted sheets are acceptable as we can reuse the elastic also.

If you would like to make masks, the following link provides easy step-by-step instructions and video. If you dont have elastic, tie strings are acceptable. Note: The pediatricians I am working with prefer two layers of 100% cotton fabric only, NO interfacing.

https://www.joann.com/make-to-give-response/?icn=hpzhero&ici=make-to-give-response

If you have questions, please email Mrs. Boyer jboyer@midbuchanan.k12.mo.us

MS Science Teacher Opening!

Mid-Buchanan School District is currently accepting applications for a 7-12. Science Teacher. Classes to teach will include junior high science as well as the possibility of 1 upper level high school life science course such as Zoology. Interested applicants must be certified or eligible to receive certification as a MS Science and HS Science from the Department of Elementary and Secondary Education. Applicants should complete an application and submit the application, resume, and cover letter to Allison Kreifels, Principal, by email at akreifels@mbdragons.com or by mail at Mid-Buchanan High School, 3221 SE State Hwy H, Faucett, MO 64448. In addition to serving in the library, there are also a variety of junior high and high school athletic and activity coaching opportunities available. For more information, contact Allison Kreifels at akreifels@mbdragons.com or at 816-238-1646. Position will remain open until filled with ongoing screening. Applications submitted via Facebook will not be considered.

Congratulations to these amazing students for their research papers being selected to be presented at the Missouri Junior Science for Humanities Symposium. They will be presenting their science research at Mizzou next Monday and Tuesday.

Twenty five papers were selected state wide and five of the selections, out of 25 in the state, came from our students. This is INCREDIBLE!!!!!

The project titles are as follows:

Bryce Batliner and Reece McClurg:
Let's Talk: A Practical Application of Speech-to-Text for Efficient Multi-Lingual Communication with the Hearing-Impaired

Weston Henning:
Engineering a Biodegradable Surfactant via Production of Glycolipids

Erin Hyde:
The Effect of Organochlorine Pesticides on Dugesia Tigrina Stem Cell Regeneration

Miguel Canchola:
Design and Analysis of a Kinetic Energy Phone Charger Model

Kaylie Yates:
Research into the Utilization of Food Waste as a Source of Biodeisel, Ethanol, and Biomass

WAY TO GO DRAGONS!!!!!

Parents,
We are currently utilizing our precautionary lockdown procedures due to a call I received from the Buchanan County Sherrif's Department regarding a report of "shots fired" approximately a half mile from the school.
